list_page_teaser: The kids who sell drugs in the lowrises in season one of The Wire have two distinctly different types of personalities.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
The portraits of the personalities of D'Angelo Barksdale and Wallace show they are both idealistic and emotional — traits that make them ill-suited for dealing in the pit.

In contrast, the images of Bodie's and Poot's temperaments show they are both realistic and logical — the opposite of Dee and Wallace. These traits give them a hardness that is better suited to a life of crime and its victims.

image_list.title: D'Angelo Barksdale
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: The Blue in D'Angelo's spiritual portrait shows he is more comfortable with ideas than with facts, and the Red shows he is more warm than cool.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Blue in this spiritual portrait represents D'Angelo's dominant personality trait, iNtuition: idealism and hope for the future; openness to ideas; very slight/moderate/strong preference for ideas over facts.

The Blue in D'Angelo's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of ideas than of facts; need for intellectual stimulation.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents D'Angelo's auxiliary personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; very slight/moderate/strong preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in D'Angelo's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/subjective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being emotional/personal/subjective rather than logical/impersonal/objective.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....

image_list.title: Bodie
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: The Yellow in Bodie's spiritual portrait shows he is open to new experiences, and the Green shows he is more logical than emotional.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Bodie's dominant personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.

The Yellow in Bodie's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas; need for sensual stimulation.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Green in this spiritual portrait represents Bodie's auxiliary personality trait, Thinking: objectivity; rationality; cool-headedness; very slight/moderate/strong preference for logic/reason/objectivity over emotion/empathy/subjectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the logical/rational/objective over the emotional/personal/subjective.

The Green in Bodie's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making logical/rational/subjective rather than emotional/personal/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being emotional/personal/subjective rather than logical/impersonal/objective.
